title: [BUG] Numba needs NumPy 1.20 or less, but `sktime` installation does not ensure this on all operating systems
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
Numba needs NumPy 1.20 or less

-->

**To Reproduce**
<!--
2_forecasting tutorial that was used in Pydata global 2021. 
right after the command 
from sktime.registry import all_estimators
all_estimators("forecaster", as_dataframe=True)

when I run all_estimators command line I get error. 

-->
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-63-9c74fc495c79> in <module>
----> 1 all_estimators("forecaster", as_dataframe=True)

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\site-packages\sktime\registry\_lookup.py in all_estimators(estimator_types, filter_tags, exclude_estimators, return_names, as_dataframe)
    140 
    141             try:
--> 142                 module = import_module(module_name)
    143                 classes = inspect.getmembers(module, inspect.isclass)
    144 

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\importlib\__init__.py in import_module(name, package)
    125                 break
    126             level += 1
--> 127     return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
    128 
    129 

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\importlib\_bootstrap.py in _gcd_import(name, package, level)

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\importlib\_bootstrap.py in _find_and_load(name, import_)

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\importlib\_bootstrap.py in _find_and_load_unlocked(name, import_)

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\importlib\_bootstrap.py in _load_unlocked(spec)

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\importlib\_bootstrap_external.py in exec_module(self, module)

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\importlib\_bootstrap.py in _call_with_frames_removed(f, *args, **kwds)

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\site-packages\sktime\annotation\clasp.py in <module>
     25 import pandas as pd
     26 
---> 27 from sktime.transformations.series.clasp import ClaSPTransformer
     28 from sktime.utils.validation.series import check_series
     29 

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\site-packages\sktime\transformations\series\clasp.py in <module>
     22 # import numpy.fft as fft
     23 import pandas as pd
---> 24 from numba import njit
     25 
     26 from sktime.transformations.base import _SeriesToSeriesTransformer

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\site-packages\numba\__init__.py in <module>
    196 
    197 _ensure_llvm()
--> 198 _ensure_critical_deps()
    199 
    200 # we know llvmlite is working as the above tests passed, import it now as SVML

C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow_env\lib\site-packages\numba\__init__.py in _ensure_critical_deps()
    136         raise ImportError("Numba needs NumPy 1.17 or greater")
    137     elif numpy_version > (1, 20):
--> 138         raise ImportError("Numba needs NumPy 1.20 or less")
    139 
    140     try:

ImportError: Numba needs NumPy 1.20 or less

_______________________________
I had pip installed sktime
